Module demo1_main
Package Mechanics

Class Food

java.lang.Object
Mechanics.SnakeObj
Mechanics.Food
public class Food extends SnakeObj

The food is a pickup that the player can collide with to gain an addition to their score. This class extends the SnakeObj abstract class

    • Food

      public Food()

      This constructor sets a default position and random image for the food object

      See Also:
      • SnakeObj

    • Food

      public Food(int x, int y)

      This constructor allows for the configuration of an x and y position for the food object. This constructor grabs a random image from the food directory.

      Parameters:
      x - Takes in an int to set the x position - Type int
      y - Takes in an int to set the y position - Type int
      See Also:
      • SnakeObj

  • Method Details

    • Eaten

      public boolean Eaten(Snake mySnake, javafx.scene.canvas.GraphicsContext g, Tree tree, SnakeModel model)

      The Eaten public function, ensures that a fruit doesn't reset in a tree and that the event adds to the player's score

      Parameters:
      mySnake - Takes in the snake object for data related to a collision (positions and rectangle area)
      g - Takes in the Graphics context to grab the width and height
      tree - Takes in a tree object to check if the fruit has spawned in a tree
      model - Takes in the model object to adhere to the "Dasher" gamemode if its flag is set to true

    • InTree

      public boolean InTree(Food f, Tree tree)

      The Eaten public function, ensures that a fruit doesn't reset in a tree and that the event adds to the player's score

      Parameters:
      f - Takes in the food object for data related to a collision (positions and rectangle area) - Type Food
      tree - Takes in a tree object for data related to a collision (positions and rectangle area) - Type Tree
      Returns:
      Returns a boolean based on the intersection between a fruit and tree object

      Specified by:
      Draw in class SnakeObj
      Parameters:
      g - Takes in a graphics context so the game canvas can be drawn to
      img - Takes in a ImageView so the renderSnake function can draw the snakes head properly - Type ImageView
